name: Abandon
description: Boost to [element] allies' multiattack rate based on turns passed
notes: Boostable by auras.
Reaches maximum effect after 10 turns.

name: Aegis
description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' HP
notes: HP boosts are additive between Normal, Omega, and EX.
Total HP boosts from weapon skills is capped at 400%
Broadsword of Earth's "Titan's Aegis" weapon skill is not a standard "Aegis" skill and is not boostable by auras. Instead, it is a flat +50 per skill level (+500 HP at skill level 10).

name: Apotheosis
description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' ATK and max HP / [Size] amplifying boost to DMG

name: Arts
description: Boost to [element] allies' skill damage cap
notes:
Boosts skill damage cap of [element] allies' skills.
Stacks additively with other weapon skills that boost skill damage cap, up to a maximum of 100%.
Stacks additively with Skill DMG Cap UpMaximum amount of skill DMG that can be dealt per hit is boosted.
Stacks additively with other weapon skills that boost skill damage cap, up to a maximum of 100%.
Stacks additively with Skill DMG Cap UpMaximum amount of skill DMG that can be dealt per hit is boosted.

name: Ascendancy
description: Boost to [element] allies' special C.A. DMG cap
notes: 10% boost to Special C.A. DMG Cap.
Special C.A. DMG Cap Up stacks up to 30% when equipping multiple copies.

name: Athos
description: Boost to [element] allies' multiattack rate / Amplify normal attack DMG (Boost to specs when either [element] Omega or [element] Optimus weapon skills have a boost of 280% or above)
notes: Boost to Athos' specs when either Elemental Omega or Elemental Optimus weapon skills have a boost of 280% or above.

name: Auspice
description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' max HP and healing cap

name: Beast Essence
description: Boost to [element] allies' DMG cap
notes:
10% boost to [element] allies' general damage cap at skill level 20.
Boost to damage cap stacks additively with weapon skill sources up to a maximum of 20%.
Stacks additively with damage cap boosts such as DMG Cap UpMaximum amount of DMG that can be dealt per hit is boosted, Extended Mastery Perks, character Support Skills, and Archangel's sub aura.
Boost to damage cap stacks additively with weapon skill sources up to a maximum of 20%.
Stacks additively with damage cap boosts such as DMG Cap UpMaximum amount of DMG that can be dealt per hit is boosted, Extended Mastery Perks, character Support Skills, and Archangel's sub aura.

name: Betrayal
description: Boost to [element] allies' ATK for first 8 turns of battle
notes: Shows up in battle as a dispellable, 8-turn ATK UpATK is boostedDuration: 8 turns buff.
This skill does not stack with itself, but will stack with a different name, i.e. 2 instances of Whirlwind's Betrayal will not stack, but Whirlwind's Betrayal and Stormwyrm's Betrayal will.

name: Bladeshield
description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' max HP and critical hit rate
notes: Boostable

name: Blessing
description: Amplify [element] allies' DMG against [inferior element] foes
notes: Affects all elemental damage dealt by [element] allies against [inferior element] foes. This includes elemental damage that differs from the ally's element.
Does not stack with an Ultima Weapon's  Fulgor ImpetusAmplifySeraphic modifier superior elemental DMG by 25%. from  Gauph Key Tria. Only the highest value takes effect.

name: Bloodrage
description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' ATK and critical hit rate / -10% DEF
notes: Bloodrage has identical skill level modifiers as Celere, but with a DEF penalty.

-10% DEF is static and unaffected by skill level and auras.
It is applied multiplicatively to your final defense, after other positive defense multipliers are calculated.
It is applied multiplicatively to your final defense, after other positive defense multipliers are calculated.

name: Bloodshed
description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' ATK / Take DMG worth 20% of max HP at Battle start
notes:
All [element] allies take damage at the start of battle, including sub allies.
This damage can't be prevented or reduced.
This damage can't be prevented or reduced.
Bloodshed HP DMG stacks additively up to 40% when equipping multiple copies.
Raising skill level only affects the ATK boost. It does not affect the damage taken by [element] allies.

name: Blow
description: Bonus [element] DMG effect to the third hit of [element] allies' triple attacks
notes: Amount of Bonus DMG effect can vary based on source.
Does not stack with similar passive A-sided Bonus Damage effects. Only the highest effect takes priority.

name: Celere
description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' ATK and critical hit rate
notes: Celere has identical skill level modifiers as Might and Verity.

name: Chain Force
description: Boost to chain burst DMG and chain burst DMG cap
notes: Chain Force grants the following based on skill level:
Chain Burst DMG Up caps at 120%.
Chain Burst DMG Cap Up caps at 100%.
Affects chain bursts of any element.

name: Charge
description: Boost to C.A. DMG, C.A. DMG cap, and special C.A. DMG cap based on how many [weapon group] are equipped
notes:
5% boost to C.A. DMG, 3% boost to C.A. DMG Cap, and 1% boost to Special C.A. Cap for all allies per [weapon group] in the grid.
Only up to 5  weapons are counted for this skill. Additional  weapons will not increase the boost provided.
Multiple copies of this skill stack additively.
[weapon group] weapons of any element contribute to the boost.
Affects allies of any element.
Only up to 5  weapons are counted for this skill. Additional  weapons will not increase the boost provided.
Multiple copies of this skill stack additively.
[weapon group] weapons of any element contribute to the boost.

name: Clarity
description: Slight chance to dodge and counter ([Size] DMG) for [element] allies
notes: Multiple weapons stack additively for both dodge and damage.

3% chance to dodge and counter whether it is small, medium, or big.
Skill level does not raise the chance to dodge.
Chance to dodge caps at 20% total.
Skill level does not raise the chance to dodge.
Chance to dodge caps at 20% total.

The following table only shows counterattack damage.

name: Convergence
description: When at least 4 weapons of the same weapon group are equipped: Boost to [element] allies' ATK, DEF, and DMG cap
notes:
When 4 or more weapons of the same weapon group are equipped (e.g., Swords, Axes, Spears, etc.), grant all [element] allies the following effects:
40% ATKMultiplier: EX Up
25% DEF Up
7% Special DMG Cap Up
40% ATKMultiplier: EX Up
25% DEF Up
7% Special DMG Cap Up
Weapons of any element are applicable.
Special damage cap stacks up to 20% when equipping multiple copies.

description: Supplement [element] allies' critical hit DMG
notes:
Supplemental damage for [element] allies' critical hits is equal to 1% of a foe's max HP (Damage cap: 20,000):
 caps at 100,000 and shares its cap with Hollowsky Weapons, Fortitude, Frailty, Pact, and Persistence.
Affected by Seraphic boost where applicable.
caps at 100,000 and shares its cap with Hollowsky Weapons, Fortitude, Frailty, Pact, and Persistence.
Affected by Seraphic boost where applicable.

notes: +5000 boost to supplemental C.A. DMG per skill level.

Supplemental boost to C.A. DMG weapon skills stack additively up to a combined cap of 1,000,000.

See Shared Caps for more stacking information.

notes: Boost stacks up to 50% when equipping multiple copies.
Deathstrike's stacking property is Passive A-side and does not stack with other Passive A-side effects. Only the highest strength takes effect.

name: Demolishment
description: [Size] amplifying boost to [element] allies' normal attack DMG
notes: Boost stacks up to 30% when equipping multiple copies.

description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' triple attack rate

description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' double attack rate

description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' max HP and triple attack rate

name: Enforcement

20% ATKMultiplier: EX Up
15% DEF Up

15% DEF Up

name: Enmity
description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' ATK based on how low HP is
notes: Boosts ATK in proportion to the percentage of the ally's missing HP.

name: Essence
description: [Size] boost to [element] primal allies' ATK

name: Excelsior
description: Boost to [element] allies' C.A. DMG cap

Multiattack rate formula: 15% × (Current HP / Maximum HP) + 5%
Multiattack rate formula: 15% × (Current HP / Maximum HP) + 5%

description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' ATK / [Size] boost to triple attack rate

notes: The 10% hit to double attack rate is unaffected by skill level and auras.

name: Healing
description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' healing cap
notes: Boosts the maximum amount that is healed by the receiver.
Heal Cap is additive across all weapon skills and caps at 100%.
This does not directly boost the amount healed. Therefore, it has no effect on fixed healing effects or effects that don't hit their normal healing cap.

name: Heed
description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' double attack rate / [SizeSlight] chance to dodge and counter ([Size] DMG)

name: Heroism
description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' max HP and double attack rate

name: Impalement
description: [Element] allies ignore a [Size] percentage of foes' DEF / Small boost to ATK
notes:
DEF Ignore does not contribute to the 50% DEF Down cap. For example, against a foe with 10 DEF and 2% DEF Ignore:
No DEF debuff: 10 * 0.98 = 9.8
25% DEF Down: 10 * 0.98 * 0.75 = 7.35
50% DEF Down: 10 * 0.98 * 0.50 = 4.9
No DEF debuff: 10 * 0.98 = 9.8

notes: Boost to Elemental ATK by a given amount per turn. Each skill instance comes with its individual maximum amount.
Both Elemental ATK per turn and individual maximum are boosted by its respective element's Optimus/Omega aura.
Elemental ATK from Progression skills caps at 75% total.
When using multiple Progression skills, the 75% cap can be reached before each skill reaches its individual maximum.

notes:
Boosts normal attack damage cap of [element] allies.

name: Striking Art
description: Boost to [element] allies' skill DMG cap and normal attack DMG cap
notes: 10% boost to [element] allies' skill damage cap
5% boost to [element] allies' normal attack damage cap

name: Supremacy
description: Massive boost to [element] allies' ATK

name: Surge
description: Boost to [element] allies' multiattack rate based on how low their HP is
notes:
Boost to double and triple attack rate of Elemental allies by 5%-35% based on ally's current HP.
Multiattack rate formula: 30% × ((Maximum HP - Current HP) / Maximum HP) + 5%
Multiattack rate formula: 30% × ((Maximum HP - Current HP) / Maximum HP) + 5%

name: Swashbuckler
description: Boost to [element] allies' skill DMG cap / Amplify skill DMG (Boost to specs when either [element] Omega or [element] Optimus weapon skills have a boost of 280% or above)
notes: Boost to Swashbuckler's specs when either Elemental Omega or Elemental Optimus weapon skills have a boost of 280% or above.
Skill Cap (Sp.) caps at 60%.
Skill Amp. (Sp.) caps at 20%.

name: Sweep
description: [Size] boost to staff-specialty [element] allies' ATK

name: Tempering
description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' skill DMG cap / [Size] supplemental boost to skill DMG
notes: Stacks additively with other weapon skills that boost skill damage cap, up to a maximum of 100%.

The supplemental damage to skill damage deals 1% of foe's maximum HP as damage.
Supplemental damage can be boosted by auras to a maximum of 200,000.
Supplemental damage can be boosted by auras to a maximum of 200,000.

name: Trituration
description: When main weapon or auxiliary weapon: Boost to [element] allies' ATK based on how many Militis weapons are equipped
notes:
23% boost to ATK (Max: 46% per copy)Multiplier: Omega for [element] allies per Militis weapon in the grid.
This effect can be boosted by auras.
This effect can be boosted by auras.

name: Trium
description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' multiattack rate

name: Truce
description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' max HP / Slight chance to dodge and counter ([Size] DMG)

name: True Supremacy
description: Massive boost to [element] allies' ATK / Small boost to max HP

name: Tyranny
description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' ATK / 10% cut to [element] allies' max HP
notes:
10% cut to HP for each Tyranny weapon skill equipped.
HP cut is additive between weapons and caps at 70%.
HP cut is additive between weapons and caps at 70%.
HP cut is static and unaffected by weapon skill level or auras.

name: Valuables
description: When 15 or more weapon skill types are active: Boost to [element] allies ATK, DEF, and DMG cap
notes:
When 15 or more weapon skill types are active, grants the following effects:
40% ATKMultiplier: EX Up
25% DEF Up
7% Special DMG Cap Up
40% ATKMultiplier: EX Up
25% DEF Up
7% Special DMG Cap Up
Special damage cap stacks up to 20% when equipping multiple copies.
Boost is calculated for each party member individually.

The skill itself counts towards the 15 weapon skill type requirement, so only 14 additional weapon skill types are needed.
Omega and Normal weapon skills count as the same weapon skill type so long as they are the same strength with the exception of Normal Big and Big II (e.g., Omega Big ATK and Normal Big II ATK are the same boost despite having different strength values).
AX and stats from Weapon Awakening do not count as weapon skill types.

Omega and Normal weapon skills count as the same weapon skill type so long as they are the same strength with the exception of Normal Big and Big II (e.g., Omega Big ATK and Normal Big II ATK are the same boost despite having different strength values).
AX and stats from Weapon Awakening do not count as weapon skill types.
Current weapon skill types can be checked using the in-game "Boosts" icon on both MC and party members.

name: Verity
description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' critical hit rate
notes: Chance to deal an additional 50% damage to weak element foes and non-elemental foes.
Total critical chance percentage is additive across all weapon skills.
Auras only boost critical chance. The critical damage modifier remains at 50% regardless of auras.
Omega Verity II corresponds to Big while Normal Verity II corresponds to Big II.
Critical chances from different sources (e.g. weapon skill, status buffs, and character support skill) activate independently.

Damage modifiers from different sources of critical hit are additive (e.g., a critical hit each from a weapon skill, a 30% / 30% Critical Hit Rate UpAttacks made with elemental superiority have a chance to deal boosted DMGStrength: 30% chance of dealing 30% more damage. buff, and a 3-star Critical Hit Extended Mastery Perk will result in 50% + 30% + 25% = 105% critical damage.)
See Critical hit rate for details.

name: Verve
description: [Size] boost to [element] allies' max HP / [Size] boost to ATK based on how high HP is
notes: Verve does not confer an ATK boost when HP is below 25%.
Verve's ATK boost values are currently identical to Stamina.

name: Vitality
description: Boost to [element] allies' ATK, DEF, and DMG cap based on their max HP
notes:
Boost to [element] allies' ATKMultiplier: EX, DEF, and special damage capStacking: Special DMG Cap based on their max HP at the start of battle.
Boost is individually calculated based on each allies' max HP value.
ATKMultiplier: EX boost formula: Max HP x 0.045%
ATK boost caps at 40% per copy. Required max HP to cap: ~89,000.
DEF boost formula: Max HP x 0.025%
DEF boost caps at 25% per copy. Required max HP to cap: 100,000.
Damage CapStacking: Special DMG Cap formula: Max HP x 0.01%
Special damage cap boost caps at 7% per copy. Required max HP to cap: 70,000.
Special damage cap stacks up to 20% when equipping multiple copies.
